Participants.evidence: Patients presenting with anterior circulation LVOS, a witnessed symptoms onset, baseline MRI within 24 h after symptoms onset and available day 1 imaging (MRI or CT) were included.

Objective.evidence: We investigated the influence of IGR on the risk of subsequent HT in the setting of large vessel occlusion stroke (LVOS) intended for endovascular treatment (EVT) and compared IGR to baseline infarct volume as predictors of HT.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary endpoint was the occurrence of any HT detected on day 1 imaging.

Result_Outcome.evidence: A faster IGR was independently associated with a higher risk of any HT (adjusted OR 1.35; 95% CI 1.16–1.57 per one log unit increase).
